excerpt: Vieux Lyon sits on the River Saône quayside, overlooked by Renaissance-era mansions with hidden courtyards and terracotta-tiled roofs. The medieval Cathédrale Saint-Jean-Baptiste is noted for its ornate astronomical clock, while the Movies & Miniature Museum showcases scale models by miniaturist Dan Ohlmann. Hilly, medieval streets lead to fine-dining restaurants and stylish bars selling Beaujolais wines.
detail_description: Vieux Lyon, located on the River Saône quayside, is a picturesque area characterized by Renaissance-era mansions with terracotta-tiled roofs and hidden courtyards. The medieval Cathédrale Saint-Jean-Baptiste boasts an ornate astronomical clock, while the Movies & Miniature Museum showcases scale models by miniaturist Dan Ohlmann. The neighborhood's hilly, medieval streets are lined with fine-dining restaurants and stylish bars offering Beaujolais wines.
name: Vieux Lyon

excerpt: 19th-century basilica with 4 octagonal towers, a religious art museum & regular Catholic services.
detail_description: The Basilica of Notre Dame of Fourvière is a 19th-century religious monument in Lyon, France. It features four octagonal towers and houses a museum showcasing religious art. Regular Catholic services are held at the basilica. Visitors can enjoy a romantic evening in Lyon by staying at the Boudoir Spa, which offers luxurious accommodations with amenities such as a Jacuzzi and hammam, providing an ideal setting for special occasions or simply spending quality time together.
name: Basilica of Notre Dame of Fourvière

excerpt: Vast, 19th-century park with statues, fountains & tall trees, plus a lake & botanic & rose gardens.
detail_description: Parc de la Tête d'Or is a vast 19th-century park located in Lyon, France. It features statues, fountains, tall trees, a lake, and botanic and rose gardens. The park offers the charming Le Petit du Parc de la Tete d'Or miniature train ride through lush gardens. Visitors can admire stunning flora and fauna while exploring hidden nooks and crannies or simply enjoying the gentle breeze and warm sunshine.
name: Parc de la Tête d'Or

excerpt: The bohemian Croix-Rousse area is a maze of leafy squares overlooked by houses that were formerly weavers’ workshops. The Mur des Canuts mural includes a scene of silk weavers at work, and there are silk-making demonstrations at the Maison des Canuts museum. Olives and cheeses are sold at the daily market on Boulevard de la Croix Rousse, and hip crowds fill gourmet patisseries, cool wine bars, and art galleries.
detail_description: La Croix-Rousse is a charming and bohemian neighborhood in Lyon, known for its maze of leafy squares and former weavers' workshops. The area features the impressive Mur des Canuts mural depicting silk weavers at work, as well as silk-making demonstrations at the Maison des Canuts museum. Visitors can explore the daily market on Boulevard de la Croix Rousse, offering olives and cheeses, while trendy patisseries, wine bars, and art galleries attract a hip crowd.
name: La Croix-Rousse

excerpt: Permanent & temporary exhibitions about anthropology & science amid dramatic, modern architecture.
detail_description: The Musée des Confluences, located in Lyon, is a striking modern museum that opened in December 2014. It boasts a futuristic architectural design and is situated at the confluence of the Rhone and Saone rivers. The museum features both permanent and temporary exhibitions that delve into anthropology, natural science, and human history. Its iconic structure resembles a transparent crystal cloud made of stainless steel and glass.
name: Musée des Confluences

detail_description: Les Halles de Lyon Paul Bocuse is a renowned food market in Lyon, known for its association with the legendary chef Paul Bocuse. The market offers a wide variety of fresh produce, meats, cheeses, and other gourmet products. It's a popular destination for food enthusiasts and tourists looking to experience authentic Lyonnaise cuisine.
name: Les Halles de Lyon Paul Bocuse

excerpt: Grand medieval cathedral with an astronomical clock & stained-glass windows, plus a treasury museum.
detail_description: Cathédrale Saint-Jean-Baptiste is a grand medieval cathedral located in the Renaissance quarter of Vieux Lyon. It features an astronomical clock and stunning stained-glass windows, as well as a treasury museum. Visitors can reach the cathedral by walking through medieval alleys or taking a funicular string with excellent views over the city.
name: Cathédrale Saint-Jean-Baptiste

excerpt: Opera, dance & concerts staged in a regal landmark featuring a rooftop terrace with city views.
detail_description: The Opéra National de Lyon is a grand neo-Renaissance opera house located in the heart of Lyon. Its historic facade, adorned with ornate columns and arched entryways, sets the stage for the opulent interior featuring gilded decorations and plush velvet seating. The magnificent auditorium can accommodate over 1,000 patrons. Architect Jean Nouvel's reconstruction in the early 90s preserved the original facade from 1831 while adding a huge cylindrical canopy that now defines its iconic appearance.
name: Opéra National de Lyon
address: 1 Pl. de la Comédie, 69001 Lyon, France

excerpt: Lyon, the capital city in France’s Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, sits at the junction of the Rhône and Saône rivers. Its center reflects 2,000 years of history from the Roman Amphithéâtre des Trois Gaules, medieval and Renaissance architecture in Vieux (Old) Lyon, to the modern Confluence district on Presqu'île peninsula. Traboules, covered passageways between buildings, connect Vieux Lyon and La Croix-Rousse hill.
detail_description: Lyon, located at the confluence of the Rhône and Saône rivers in France's Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes region, is a city steeped in history. Its rich heritage is evident in its diverse architecture, ranging from the ancient Roman Amphithéâtre des Trois Gaules to the medieval and Renaissance buildings of Vieux Lyon and the contemporary structures in the Confluence district.
name: Lyon

excerpt: Reached by funicular from Vieux Lyon, hilltop Fourvière centers around the ornate Basilique Notre Dame de Fourvière. The Tour Métallique de Fourvière overlooks tree-shaded Des Hauteurs Park and resembles a mini Eiffel Tower. Open-air concerts are held at the Théâtre Gallo Romain, which connects by tunnel to the Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvière and its Roman treasures. Brasseries cluster at the foot of the hill.
detail_description: Perched on a hill and accessible by funicular from Vieux Lyon, Fourvière is dominated by the grand Basilique Notre Dame de Fourvière. The area also features the Tour Métallique de Fourvière, offering panoramic views of Des Hauteurs Park. Visitors can enjoy open-air concerts at the Théâtre Gallo Romain and explore the Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvière with its Roman artifacts.
name: Fourvière

excerpt: Huge fresco of a neighborhood of silk workers who rebelled against working conditions in the 1800s.
detail_description: The Mur des Canuts, located on the Boulevard des Canuts in Lyon's Croix Rousse district, is a massive mural that showcases the history of the neighborhood, once inhabited by silk weavers known as canuts. Painted in trompe-l'oeil style, it seamlessly integrates with its surroundings. Initially created in 1987, this mural has been periodically updated to reflect changes to nearby structures.
name: Mur des Canuts

excerpt: Modern hillside museum on Roman archeological site with a large collection of art, pottery & coins.
detail_description: Perched on a hillside, the Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvière offers a captivating journey through the city's ancient history. The museum boasts an extensive collection of art, pottery, and coins from the Roman era. Its audacious architecture provides a striking contrast between contemporary design and ornate Roman relics. Visitors can explore well-preserved ancient constructions such as the Roman Theatre, Odeon, and Roman Baths nearby.
name: Gallo-Roman Museum of Lyon-Fourvière

detail_description: Running between the Hotel de Ville and Place des Terreaux, there's a lively street lined with an array of vibrant bars.
name: Place des Terreaux

excerpt: Museum of hyper-realistic, miniature everyday scenes, plus movie props & special effects exhibits.
detail_description: Nestled in the historic heart of Lyon, the Musée Cinéma et Miniature is a treasure trove for film enthusiasts and miniature art lovers alike. Set within a beautifully restored 17th-century building, this museum showcases an impressive array of hyper-realistic miniature scenes that transport visitors into the world of cinema.
name: Musée Cinéma et Miniature

excerpt: Art museum in former 17th-century abbey, with ancient & modern paintings, sculptures & artifacts.
detail_description: The Museum of Fine Arts of Lyon is housed in a former 17th-century abbey and features a diverse collection of ancient and modern paintings, sculptures, and artifacts. It is considered one of the best museums in Lyon, France, offering visitors the opportunity to explore exhibits spanning from the Middle Ages to contemporary art. The museum provides a unique experience with its well-curated pathways showcasing remarkable artworks by renowned painters.
name: Museum of Fine Arts of Lyon

excerpt: Vast, tree-lined public square with flower stalls & a small art museum, plus a seasonal ice-rink.
detail_description: Place Bellecour is a vast and picturesque public square located in Lyon, France. It is known for its tree-lined avenues, flower stalls, and a small art museum. The square stretches from the lower part of the Presqu'ile between Lyon's two rivers to the Confluences area where the Rhone and Saone meet. It is considered Europe's largest square and features an impressive equestrian statue of Louis XIV.
name: Place Bellecour

detail_description: Les Traboules du Vieux Lyon, often referred to as the Secret Passageways of Old Lyon, are a fascinating maze of covered walkways that weave through the city's historic Renaissance district. Dating back to the 4th century, these unique passages were initially designed to offer residents sheltered routes between their homes and the bustling River Saône. Over time, they adapted to various needs—serving as safe havens during turbulent times and facilitating trade in silk when Lyon thrived as a production center.
name: Traboules du Vieux Lyon

detail_description: Place Bellecour, known simply as Bellecour to the locals, is a central square located in the Presquile area. It is surrounded by luxury boutiques and nightspots, making it an integral part of everyday life for residents. At its center stands a statue of Louis XIV on horseback, with two bronzes representing the Rhone and Saone rivers on either side. The square offers a picturesque view of Fourviere hill from above the surrounding rooftops.
name: Place Bellecour

detail_description: Traboule is a network of hidden passageways in Lyon, France, which were historically used by silk traders. While some Traboules are open to the public, many are still private residences and should be respected as such. Visitors can admire these unique architectural features from the outside but may not always have access to explore them fully.
name: Traboule (privé)

excerpt: In addition to screening iconic films, this museum also features antique movie-making equipment.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant 8th arrondissement of Lyon, the Institut Lumière is a must-visit for cinema enthusiasts and history buffs alike. This captivating museum not only showcases iconic films but also houses an impressive collection of antique filmmaking equipment that pays tribute to the pioneering work of Louis and Auguste Lumière. The brothers are celebrated as the fathers of cinema, having created groundbreaking works like 'Workers Leaving The Lumiere Factory,' which is often regarded as one of the first motion pictures ever made.
name: Institut Lumière
address: Rue du Premier Film, 69008 Lyon, France

detail_description: Musée des Beaux-Arts is housed in a remarkable building located between the Rhone and Saonne rivers. Originally an abbey, it was repurposed during the French Revolution and renamed The Palais du commerce et des Arts. The museum boasts an extensive collection of artworks, archaeological items, and natural history exhibits. Its rich history and diverse range of exhibits make it a must-visit destination for art and history enthusiasts alike.
name: Musée des Beaux-Arts

excerpt: This huge, trompe-l'oeil painting on the side of a building depicts 30 well-known people from Lyon.
detail_description: The Fresque des Lyonnais, also known as the Mural of the Lyonnais, is a magnificent trompe l'oeil painting that graces the exterior of a building in Lyon. This impressive artwork, created by renowned artist Raymond Moretti in 1995, showcases 30 influential and celebrated figures from the city's history.
name: Fresque des Lyonnais
address: 2 Rue de la Martinière, 69001 Lyon, France

excerpt: Film museum, documentation center & library at the site of the Lumière factory, family villa & park.
detail_description: Musée Lumière, also known as Institut Lumiere, is a film museum and documentation center located at the site of the Lumière factory, family villa, and park in Lyon. It pays homage to the Lumière brothers, considered the fathers of cinema and inventors of the cinematograph. The museum features artifacts chronicling the history of cinematography and showcases some of their short films. Visitors can explore the former residence of Auguste and Louis Lumiere while learning about their lives.
name: Musée Lumière
address: 25 Rue du Premier Film, 69008 Lyon, France

excerpt: Performance space dating to the 19th century, with an ornate facade & a red-&-gold interior.
detail_description: Célestins, Théâtre de Lyon is a historic performance space with a rich legacy dating back to 1792. The ornate Italian-style building, designed by architect Gaspard Andre, features a charming facade and a stunning red-and-gold interior. Visitors can take tours of the theater and admire its grand Great Hall outside of showtimes. The annual calendar offers diverse performances ranging from classic French plays to international productions.
name: Célestins, Théâtre de Lyon

excerpt: Guided tours of 19th-century building with displays tracing 5 centuries of silk production in Lyon.
detail_description: La Maison des Canuts, located in the charming Croix-Rousse district of Vieux Lyon, is a captivating museum that delves into the fascinating world of silk production. This historic 19th-century building showcases five centuries of textile artistry and pays homage to the Canuts, the skilled weavers who established Lyon as a hub for silk craftsmanship. Visitors can embark on guided tours that reveal the intricate processes behind silk-making and witness live demonstrations featuring the revolutionary Jacquard loom.
name: La Maison des Canuts

excerpt: Mansion museum housing notable 17th-18th century, textile & decorative arts collections.
detail_description: The Musée des Tissus et des Arts Décoratifs is a mansion museum that houses remarkable collections of 17th-18th century textiles and decorative arts. It offers an insightful look into Lyon's silk industry, showcasing the city's deep-rooted connection to textile production through its extraordinary collection of historic fabrics and costumes.
name: Musée des Tissus et des Arts Décoratifs
address: 34 Rue de la Charité, 69002 Lyon, France

excerpt: Exhibitions on the Resistance movement & the deportation of Jews in Lyon during the Nazi occupation.
detail_description: The Centre d'histoire de la résistance et de la déportation in Lyon is a museum that commemorates the city's tumultuous history during World War II. It stands on the former site of the Nazi Gestapo headquarters, where countless individuals were tortured by Klaus Barbie, infamously known as 'the Butcher of Lyon.'
name: Centre d'histoire de la résistance et de la déportation

excerpt: Large, modern retail complex with stores, restaurants & a move theater, plus waterfront views.
detail_description: Confluence is a modern retail complex in Lyon's 2nd arrondissement, situated at the convergence of the Rhone and Saone rivers. Once an industrial area, it has been revitalized with contemporary buildings designed by renowned architects. The district features a vibrant commercial artery, Cours Charlemagne, offering trendy restaurants and cafes like Maison Pepin and Platypus Brewpub.
name: Confluence

detail_description: Lyon is a city that boasts around 100 large murals adorning its walls, particularly in working-class neighborhoods and on social housing. These artworks serve as a draw for visitors to explore areas they might not have otherwise ventured into. One notable site is the outdoor museum in Etats-Unis, featuring 25 murals from the 1980s that depict the career of architect Tony Garnier, who designed this district in the 1920s.
name: Mural

detail_description: Embarking on a journey to the presque-isle, one cannot miss the grandeur of Place Bellecour and its surrounding narrow shopping streets.
name: Place Bellecour

excerpt: The substantial ruins of a pair of Roman theaters, now used for open-air concerts & festivals.
detail_description: Théâtre Gallo Romain, also known as the Gallo-Roman theatre, is a significant historical site in Lyon that offers a glimpse into the city's ancient Roman past. The ruins of two Roman theaters are now used for open-air concerts and festivals, providing visitors with a unique cultural experience.
name: Théâtre Gallo Romain

excerpt: This stately 17th-century landmark with 2 courtyards & an ornate interior now serves as city hall.
detail_description: The Hôtel de Ville de Lyon is a beautiful building with impressive architecture from the 17th century. It now serves as the city hall in Lyon. The building is very lively in the evening with all the illumination, and it is a must-go destination if you are in Lyon.
name: Hôtel de Ville de Lyon
address: 1 Pl. de la Comédie, 69001 Lyon, France

excerpt: Expansive green zoological gardens, housing exotic animals from Asia, Africa & the Americas.
detail_description: The Lyon Zoo is a large and expansive zoo that houses a variety of different animals from all over the world. It is great for families to visit and is especially popular among kids. The zoo also features a big botanical garden, public bathrooms, and lots of green spaces to relax in.
name: Lyon Zoo
address: Parc de la Tête d'Or, All. de l'Orangerie, 69006 Lyon, France

excerpt: UNESCO World Heritage-listed street constructed in 1860 with boutiques, restaurants & cafes.
detail_description: Rue de la République is a UNESCO World Heritage-listed street in Lyon, constructed in 1860 and known for its boutiques, restaurants, and cafes. It serves as the main shopping street at the heart of the city, featuring a variety of stores including well-known brands like H&M, Etam, Monoprix, and Lush.
name: Rue de la République

detail_description: Paroisse Catholique Saint Martin d'Ainay, also known as the Basilique - Abbaye Saint-Martin d'Ainay, is the oldest church in Lyon, dating back to the 11th century and built on the site of a 4th-century Roman temple. This Romanesque Benedictine basilica showcases a mix of pre-Romanesque, Romanesque, and Gothic architectural styles.
name: Basilique Saint-Martin-d’Ainay

detail_description: If you're in need of a peaceful break from sightseeing, head over to the historic Place des Jacobins in the 2nd arrondissement. This beautiful square dates back to 1556 and is home to a central fountain added in 1856. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it's just a short walk from the River Saone and the Palais de Justice.
name: Place des Jacobins

excerpt: Nearly 50 pools filled with as many as 300 species, including a shark pit & a touch pool.
detail_description: The Aquarium of Lyon, which first opened in 2002 and underwent renovations in 2010, offers an educational experience focused on marine ecosystems and ocean-related environmental issues. With nearly 50 pools showcasing up to 300 species, including a shark pit and touch pool, the aquarium provides a glimpse into various ocean zones such as tropical and temperate waters. Visitors can explore exhibits on coral reefs and unique marine species aimed at raising awareness about biodiversity conservation.
name: Aquarium of Lyon
address: 7 Rue Stéphane Dechant, 69350 La Mulatière, France

detail_description: Presqu'île Fleurs is a vibrant district in Lyon, situated between the Rhone and Saone rivers. This area was created through an ambitious 18th-century project that transformed marshes into a bustling urban center. The district boasts stunning 19th-century architecture, spacious plazas, shops, cultural venues, restaurants, cafes, bars, and nightclubs. Notable landmarks like the Lyons opera house and city hall are found here.
name: Presqu'île Fleurs
address: 44 Rue du Président Édouard Herriot, 69002 Lyon, France

detail_description: Boat Hermes Restaurant in Lyon offers a unique dining experience with its gourmet Lyonnais cuisine and guided tours of the city on the Rhone and Saone rivers. The restaurant is praised for its excellent food, friendly staff, and efficient service. It's considered one of the best romantic restaurants in Lyon, providing a beautiful setting for special occasions. Guests can enjoy a leisurely cruise while savoring delicious meals with stunning presentations.
name: Boat Hermes Restaurant (Restaurant Cruises in Lyon)

detail_description: Saint-Georges is one of the charming districts in Lyon's atmospheric Quartier Saint-Jean, offering a glimpse into the old-world ambience of Vieux Lyon. This medieval quarter boasts narrow cobblestone lanes and quiet courtyards, making it perfect for leisurely strolls. The district is home to Eglise Saint-Georges, a must-see attraction along with Eglise St. Paul and the cathedral St.
name: Saint-Georges

detail_description: Discover the charm of Bas des Pentes Presqu'île, a delightful urban route perfect for family outings. This scenic walk takes you through the heart of Lyon, circling the Presqu'ile and meandering along the Rhone and Saone riverbanks. Stroll along the picturesque Quays of the Rhone, Confluence, and Saone as you soak in the city's rich history.
name: Bas des Pentes Presqu'île

detail_description: The Fêtes des Lumières 2024 in Lyon promises to be an enchanting experience, taking place annually on December 8th. This vibrant festival honors the Virgin Mary, who is believed to have protected the city from the Bubonic plague back in 1643. As night falls, Lyon transforms into a dazzling spectacle of lights and colors that captivates both locals and visitors alike.
name: Fêtes des Lumières 2024

excerpt: Dramatic fountain by the famous French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi, unveiled in 1892.
detail_description: Bartholdi Fountain, created by the renowned French sculptor Frédéric Auguste Bartholdi, was unveiled in 1892. It is located at Place des Terreaux in Lyon and is a must-see attraction. The fountain's design exudes a sense of movement and energy, making it a remarkable sight for visitors. During the day, its refreshing coolness provides relief from the heat, while at night it is illuminated with cozy lighting.
name: Bartholdi Fountain

excerpt: Cobblestoned pedestrian road lined with shops & eateries & named for the Saint-Jean cathedral.
detail_description: Nestled in the enchanting Vieux Lyon, Rue Saint-Jean is a cobblestoned pedestrian street that beautifully captures the essence of this historic city. Named after the iconic Saint-Jean Cathedral, it boasts an array of charming Renaissance buildings, delightful boutiques, and inviting cafes that beckon visitors to explore.
name: Rue Saint-Jean

excerpt: Displays on the history of books & printing within a 15th-century mansion, including engravings.
detail_description: Located in a 15th-century mansion, the Musée de l'Imprimerie et de la Communication Graphique in Lyon is dedicated to showcasing the history of bookmaking, printing, and graphic art. The museum features a diverse collection of French and Western book prints from renowned artists, along with 20th-century printing tools. Visitors can explore historical printing techniques, typography evolution, antique presses, and rare books through interactive workshops that offer hands-on experience with traditional printing methods.
name: Musée de l'imprimerie et de la communication graphique
address: 13 Rue de la Poulaillerie, 69002 Lyon, France

detail_description: Maison de la Danse is a vibrant and modern dance theatre that offers an exciting array of performances, making it a must-visit for culture enthusiasts. Located slightly away from the city center, visitors are greeted by an intriguing industrial aesthetic as they approach the venue. The theatre has undergone various adaptations over time, enhancing its functionality with amenities like a bar and restaurant. While seating may feel a bit snug during busy shows, the excellent visibility and quality acoustics ensure an enjoyable experience.
name: Maison de la danse

detail_description: The sightseeing tour agency Visiter le Vieux Lyon et ses traboules is a great way to get lost in the medieval town of Lyon and explore its secret passages. The winding alleyways are perfect for Silk Merchants, as they made it easy to move about for 90000 workers. They're like a maze, amazing, mysterious and too dark to live in; Suitable for visiting by candlelight only!
name: VISITER LE VIEUX LYON & SES TRABOULES

excerpt: Puppetry museum in a Renaissance building offering marionette shows, exhibits & hands-on activities.
detail_description: Located in a Renaissance building, the Musée des arts de la marionnette - Gadagne is a must-visit attraction in Lyon for those interested in puppetry. The museum offers marionette shows, exhibits, and hands-on activities suitable for visitors of all ages. With over 2,000 puppets on display from around the world, along with sets, programs, archive films, and contributions from contemporary puppeteers, it provides an insightful and entertaining experience.
name: Musée des arts de la marionnette - Gadagne
address: 1 Pl. du Petit Collège, 69005 Lyon, France

excerpt: Riverside green space with lawns for picnicking & playing, plus seasonal blooms & a skatepark.
detail_description: Parc de Gerland, also known as Parc du Confluent, is a spacious green area located in the 7th arrondissement of Lyon, along the banks of the River Rhone. It is the second largest park in Lyon after Parc de la Tete d'Or. The park offers various activities such as picnicking, playing sports, and enjoying seasonal blooms. It features a skatepark that appeals to young people and an indoor/outdoor skatepark.
name: Parc de Gerland
address: All. Pierre de Coubertin, 69007 Lyon, France

excerpt: This botanical garden dating from 1857 features greenhouses filled with 15,000 species of plants.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Lyon, the Lyon Botanical Garden, or Jardin Botanique de Lyon, is a captivating oasis that has been enchanting visitors since its establishment in 1857. Spanning an impressive 8 hectares, this garden boasts a remarkable collection of around 15,000 plant species housed within its lush greenhouses and sprawling outdoor spaces. As you wander through the meticulously curated flower beds and serene pathways, you'll encounter everything from giant lily pads to unique succulents.
name: Lyon Botanical Garden
